TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit VirtualFileBase extends System.MarshalByRefObject

Docs.summary: Provides the core implementation for the and objects. An abstract class, it cannot be instantiated.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Hosting.VirtualFileBase> abstract class provides the common methods and properties shared between the <xref:System.Web.Hosting.VirtualFile> and <xref:System.Web.Hosting.VirtualDirectory> objects. Implementations of these classes provide the ASP.NET runtime with access to files and paths used for compilation. For more information on using virtual files and paths, see the <xref:System.Web.Hosting.VirtualPathProvider> class.

block.para: When you inherit from the class, you must override the property to indicate whether the derived object is a virtual directory or a virtual file. If you derive from either the or the class, the property is already set.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance. This constructor can be called only by an inherited class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Although you cannot directly construct an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Hosting.VirtualFileBase> class, you can call this constructor from the constructor of an inheriting class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance object InitializeLifetimeService() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gives a instance an infinite lifetime by preventing a lease from being created.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method overrides the <xref:System.MarshalByRefObject.InitializeLifetimeService%2A> method on its base class. It always returns `null` and thereby prevents a lease from being created that would limit the lifetime of the virtual file or directory.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the instance represents a virtual file or a virtual directory.
Docs.value: if the instance is a virtual directory; otherwise, if the instance is a virtual file.

Docs.summary: Gets the display name of the virtual resource.
Docs.value: The display name of the virtual file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Hosting.VirtualFileBase.Name%2A> property is typically the file name and extension associated with the resource, although virtual resources may use arbitrary names.

block.para: The property should return the correct casing of the virtual resource for the virtual path provider. The correct casing may be different from the casing in the original path.

Docs.value: The path to the virtual file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Hosting.VirtualFileBase.VirtualPath%2A> property returns the path to the file or directory represented by this object.
